text: Louis James Nolan (born December 3, 1945) is the public address announcer for the Philadelphia Flyers of the National Hockey League. He has worked in this position since the 1972–73 NHL season, when he replaced former announcer Kevin Johnson.http://flyers.nhl.com/club/news.htm?id=508500 He has been on the PA for 8 Stanley Cup Finals, two NHL All-Star Games, the 2014 NCAA Frozen Four, and the 2014 NHL Entry Draft. When the 2004-05 season was cancelled because of a lockout, He was able to continue his duties with the Flyers AHL affiliate the Philadelphia Phantoms. He attended St. Barnabas School and West Catholic High School in Philadelphia. He is married to Ellen and has two children.http://articles.philly.com/2008-09-26/sports/25247472_1_ahl-phantoms- spectrum-pr-director He resides in Penn Valley, Pennsylvania. Nolan's book "If These Walls Could Talk: Philadelphia Flyers" (Triumph Books) was released in November 2017. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:Living people Category:People from Philadelphia Category:Philadelphia Flyers Category:National Hockey League public address announcers
